name: 1 Bowl Vegan Blueberry Muffins
description: Wonderful Vegan Blueberry Muffins, made in just 1 bowl! They are fluffy, moist and full of fresh blueberries. You will love how easy they are to make!

video.name: 1 Bowl Vegan Blueberry Muffins
video.description: Wonderful Vegan Blueberry Muffins, made in just 1 bowl! They are fluffy, moist and full of fresh blueberries. You will love how easy they are to make!

recipeIngredient: 2 cups all purpose flour (see notes for substitutions)
1-2 tablespoons coarse sugar, optional, for sprinkling the tops

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Line a standard muffin pan with liners and spray them lightly with oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Line a standard muffin pan with liners and spray them lightly with oil.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the soy milk and apple cider vinegar in a measuring cup and set aside to curdle. This is your "buttermilk".
recipeInstructions.name: Combine the soy milk and apple cider vinegar in a measuring cup and set aside to curdle. This is your "buttermilk".

recipeInstructions.text: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together all the dry ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and cornstarch.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together all the dry ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and cornstarch.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour in the soy milk/vinegar mixture, canola oil and vanilla. Stir with a large spoon to combine, but do not over mix. Some small lumps are fine.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour in the soy milk/vinegar mixture, canola oil and vanilla. Stir with a large spoon to combine, but do not over mix. Some small lumps are fine.

recipeInstructions.text: Fold in the blueberries, gently. Using a small measuring cup or ice cream scoop, add batter to the liners in the pan 3/4 of the way full. Top with a few extra blueberries and a sprinkle of coarse sugar, if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Fold in the blueberries, gently. Using a small measuring cup or ice cream scoop, add batter to the liners in the pan 3/4 of the way full. Top with a few extra blueberries and a sprinkle of coarse sugar, if desired.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 22-26 minutes, until golden brown on top and a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Let cool 5 minutes in the pan, then move to a cooling rack. Eat and enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 22-26 minutes, until golden brown on top and a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Let cool 5 minutes in the pan, then move to a cooling rack. Eat and enjoy!

recipeInstructions.text: Store leftover muffins in an airtight container at room temperature for about 3 days. You can also freeze them by wrapping them in plastic wrap and placing them in a large freezer bag.
recipeInstructions.name: Store leftover muffins in an airtight container at room temperature for about 3 days. You can also freeze them by wrapping them in plastic wrap and placing them in a large freezer bag.
